articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Country Garden (2007.HK) has won approval from its creditors to extend the repayments on six onshore bonds by three years, said two sources familiar with the matter.
articles.title: Country Garden wins approval to extend six onshore bond repayments by 3 years - sources

articles.author: Noel Randewich, Hannah Lang
articles.description: Retail traders getting their first bite at Arm Holdings' highly anticipated public offering when the British chip designer begins trading this week should beware: individual investors often get burned when they jump on hot listings.
articles.title: For retail investors, jumping on Arm's blockbuster IPO is a risky business

articles.author: Leika Kihara
articles.description: The Bank of Japan is under pressure to defend a new cap for long-term interest rates set just six weeks ago, as Governor Kazuo Ueda's hawkish remarks heightened market expectations of a near-term end to its negative interest rate policy.
articles.title: What will BOJ's policy normalisation path look like?

articles.author: Casey Hall
articles.description: New Alibaba Group CEO Eddie Wu has told staff the tech giant's two main strategic focuses going forward will be "user first" and "AI-driven", according to an internal letter reviewed by Reuters.
articles.title: New Alibaba Group CEO lays out strategic priorities for staff -letter

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Tesla rallied 6% on Monday after Morgan Stanley said its Dojo supercomputer could power a near $600 billion surge in the electric-car maker's market value by helping speed up its foray into robotaxis and software services.
articles.title: Tesla jumps as analyst predicts $600 bln value boost from Dojo

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: A state governor in Mexico said on Monday that Tesla (TSLA.O) and its suppliers would invest $15 billion over the next two years in a factory that is still under construction, an amount that is triple what Mexican officials previously announced.
articles.title: Tesla, suppliers to invest $15 bln in Mexico factory - local governor

articles.author: Nupur Anand
articles.description: JPMorgan Chase (JPM.N) CEO Jamie Dimon blasted stricter capital rules proposed by U.S. regulators, telling investors on Monday that they could prompt lenders to pull back and stymie economic growth.
articles.title: JPMorgan CEO Jamie Dimon blasts draft US bank capital rules

articles.author: Josh Smith, Hyunsu Yim
articles.description: North Korean leader Kim Jong Un has arrived in Russia, Japanese media reported on Tuesday, for what the Kremlin said would be a comprehensive discussion with President Vladimir Putin amid warnings from Washington they should not agree on an arms deal.
articles.title: North Korea's Kim Jong Un in Russia amid U.S. warnings not to sell arms

articles.author: Alexander Cornwell, Ahmed Eljechtimi
articles.description: Villagers in parts of Morocco devastated by the country's biggest earthquake in over a century camped outside for a fourth night on Monday, as the death toll rose to more than 2,800 people.
articles.title: Morocco earthquake death toll passes 2,800, survivors camp outdoors

articles.author: Mikhail Flores
articles.description: Philippines Nobel laureate Maria Ressa and her news site Rappler were acquitted of tax fraud by a trial court on Tuesday, in another legal victory for the embattled journalist and for press freedom in the Southeast Asian country.
articles.title: Nobel laureate Ressa acquitted in Philippine tax case
